R.content: [Nietzsche-like?] [Derrida by way of Aristotle by way of Plato] the “just more than one,” a god among men, not a part of a whole or calculable series; law, calculability, would betray justice for those who are the law > fable of sovereignty returns
R.linkedContent: [Nietzsche-like?] [Derrida by way of Aristotle by way of Plato] the “just more than one,” a god among men, not a part of a whole or calculable series; law, calculability, would betray justice for those who are the law > fable of sovereignty returns

KH.content: double exclusion (neither this nor that), participation (both this & that), can we transport this logic, para-logic from one set to another
KH.linkedContent: double exclusion (neither this nor that), participation (both this & that), can we transport this logic, para-logic from one set to another

KH.content: displacement from type of existent thing to type of discourse via metonymy (sensible/intelligible > mythos/logos)
KH.linkedContent: displacement from type of existent thing to type of discourse via metonymy (sensible/intelligible > mythos/logos)

LOBL.content: [3 options re: relation btwn Blanchot’s L’arrêt de mort and the Gospels] 1) Gospel as paradigm 2) récit as paradigm (of Gospel) 3) seriality w/out paradigm [cf. GLAS]
LOBL.linkedContent: [3 options re: relation btwn Blanchot’s L’arrêt de mort and the Gospels] 1) Gospel as paradigm 2) récit as paradigm (of Gospel) 3) seriality w/out paradigm [cf. GLAS]

LOBL.content: “come”: single word, yet intertwined in series, inscribes its own effacement in middle of and on invaginated boundaries of récit, of these crypts, death or bridal chambers, hymen brings alliance & separation [after theft of key]
LOBL.linkedContent: “come”: single word, yet intertwined in series, inscribes its own effacement in middle of and on invaginated boundaries of récit, of these crypts, death or bridal chambers, hymen brings alliance & separation [after theft of key]

MPM.content: Gedächtnis calls itself beyond interiorizing memory (Erinnerung), beyond inclusion of part in whole, thinks itself as a “part” which is greater than “whole” > trace beyond mournful memory
MPM.linkedContent: Gedächtnis calls itself beyond interiorizing memory (Erinnerung), beyond inclusion of part in whole, thinks itself as a “part” which is greater than “whole” > trace beyond mournful memory

MPM.content: all figures receive possibility from these paradoxical structures: 1) inclusion in set of a part greater than set 2) that which regulates our relation w/ other as other [not mourning in current sense], that the other is capable of dying (which is our “own” mortality too) conditions rhetoric of faithful memory, serves to seal an alliance & call us to an affirmation of the other
MPM.linkedContent: all figures receive possibility from these paradoxical structures: 1) inclusion in set of a part greater than set 2) that which regulates our relation w/ other as other [not mourning in current sense], that the other is capable of dying (which is our “own” mortality too) conditions rhetoric of faithful memory, serves to seal an alliance & call us to an affirmation of the other

A.content: no escaping ontologico-juridico-transcendental tradition [method], except w/ death, aporia, unique exclusion from system, “life death” no longer falls under case of what it makes possible
A.linkedContent: no escaping ontologico-juridico-transcendental tradition [method], except w/ death, aporia, unique exclusion from system, “life death” no longer falls under case of what it makes possible

A.content: pass from hostage to host/guest from host/guest to ghost in series: hostage, host, guest, ghost, holy ghost, Geist
A.linkedContent: pass from hostage to host/guest from host/guest to ghost in series: hostage, host, guest, ghost, holy ghost, Geist

VM.content: structure [inside-outside] has no meaning w/out included origin, inscribed eastern horizon which is neither w/in nor w/out space
VM.linkedContent: structure [inside-outside] has no meaning w/out included origin, inscribed eastern horizon which is neither w/in nor w/out space

PP.content: excess, displacement of series, n’est pas une simple sortie hors de la série (ce geste tombe sous une catégorie de la série), a folding back (repli), a re-mark, cannot name it with a single concept w/out being off the mark (sans le manquer): it is a real and necessary challenge that writes itself, and we must begin by reading it
PP.linkedContent: excess, displacement of series, n’est pas une simple sortie hors de la série (ce geste tombe sous une catégorie de la série), a folding back (repli), a re-mark, cannot name it with a single concept w/out being off the mark (sans le manquer): it is a real and necessary challenge that writes itself, and we must begin by reading it

FWT.content: DP either internal to criminal law, one punishment among others, or external, non-serial exemplarity, hyperbolic, foundation, condition, more/other than a penalty
FWT.linkedContent: DP either internal to criminal law, one punishment among others, or external, non-serial exemplarity, hyperbolic, foundation, condition, more/other than a penalty

DS.content: supplementary “blank,” in marking itself, intervenes btwn all series, prevents semantic seriality from closing itself, c’est encore lui qui libère des effets de série > makes us take agglomerates for substances
DS.linkedContent: supplementary “blank,” in marking itself, intervenes btwn all series, prevents semantic seriality from closing itself, c’est encore lui qui libère des effets de série > makes us take agglomerates for substances

ROP.content: principle of series transcends meaning of the elements in the series which are given meaning by such a principle [in this case, Freud’s 5 resistances lose meaning in face of the hyperbolic resistance: repetition compulsion, Derrida’s use of formal logic]
ROP.linkedContent: principle of series transcends meaning of the elements in the series which are given meaning by such a principle [in this case, Freud’s 5 resistances lose meaning in face of the hyperbolic resistance: repetition compulsion, Derrida’s use of formal logic]

ROP.content: quasi-transcendental (formal) law of seriality (when condition is part of the series) creates aporias not to be avoided—the very chance to think [hors-série]
ROP.linkedContent: quasi-transcendental (formal) law of seriality (when condition is part of the series) creates aporias not to be avoided—the very chance to think [hors-série]

OTO.content: how can reactive degeneration [Nazism] exploit same utterances, rallying cries, of active forces [Übermensch]—nor did this specular ruse elude Nietzsche: is there a “programming machine”? marrying the 2 forces (family resemblances) in a set, as life (does) death? but no regional power could set limit on such a set > no ordinary “machine,” there’s “life” in it > plays w/ opposition life/death > is there a practical rewriting of the program, which would no longer be part of it? if so, would not be produced in books
OTO.linkedContent: how can reactive degeneration [Nazism] exploit same utterances, rallying cries, of active forces [Übermensch]—nor did this specular ruse elude Nietzsche: is there a “programming machine”? marrying the 2 forces (family resemblances) in a set, as life (does) death? but no regional power could set limit on such a set > no ordinary “machine,” there’s “life” in it > plays w/ opposition life/death > is there a practical rewriting of the program, which would no longer be part of it? if so, would not be produced in books

ATIA.content: divinanimality, quasi-transcendental referent, sacrificed/disavowed foundation of what it founds: justice, symbolic, human order [brings Levinas & Lacan close] > difficulty of uttering discourse of transcendence/mastery e: animal in the name of God/Law
ATIA.linkedContent: divinanimality, quasi-transcendental referent, sacrificed/disavowed foundation of what it founds: justice, symbolic, human order [brings Levinas & Lacan close] > difficulty of uttering discourse of transcendence/mastery e: animal in the name of God/Law

GSP.content: Husserl: foundation of math found in mathematical, logic in logical, ethics in ethical
GSP.linkedContent: Husserl: foundation of math found in mathematical, logic in logical, ethics in ethical

GSP.content: genetic description of ego prescribes task of a universal genetic phenomenology (a eidos of historicity) for Husserl, this is not a series of ruptures, revolutions, that tear open a previous finitude to lay bear a hidden infinity, giving voice to dynamis of silence > the ruptures are always already indicated [Telos] [Derrida wonders if this a metaphysical affirmation in a phenemonology]
GSP.linkedContent: genetic description of ego prescribes task of a universal genetic phenomenology (a eidos of historicity) for Husserl, this is not a series of ruptures, revolutions, that tear open a previous finitude to lay bear a hidden infinity, giving voice to dynamis of silence > the ruptures are always already indicated [Telos] [Derrida wonders if this a metaphysical affirmation in a phenemonology]

O.content: if one is captive to formulas and absolute knowledge, can’t think anything outside the whole, not even its mimetic double
O.linkedContent: if one is captive to formulas and absolute knowledge, can’t think anything outside the whole, not even its mimetic double

O.content: if we can question and think about formula of absolute knowledge, the “part” then is bigger than the whole, strange subtraction of a remark, dissemination would then constitute the whole as a totality-effect
O.linkedContent: if we can question and think about formula of absolute knowledge, the “part” then is bigger than the whole, strange subtraction of a remark, dissemination would then constitute the whole as a totality-effect

O.content: literature is the exception in the whole and the exception to everything (l’exception de tout) (subtraction w/out lack), part (pièce) which exists by itself [solitude], marks le tout autre
O.linkedContent: literature is the exception in the whole and the exception to everything (l’exception de tout) (subtraction w/out lack), part (pièce) which exists by itself [solitude], marks le tout autre

DST.content: play of de- might belong to hyperbologic, belongs to and escapes its own series: “gift of mimesis,” “gift of impropriety,” not negative (dialecticizable)
DST.linkedContent: play of de- might belong to hyperbologic, belongs to and escapes its own series: “gift of mimesis,” “gift of impropriety,” not negative (dialecticizable)

DST.content: organizes/disorganizes what it appears to determine
DST.linkedContent: organizes/disorganizes what it appears to determine

TR.content: series of deconstructions: deconstruction of deconstruction of figures

IW.content: Jew and German: “lack of transition,” a ruptivity, “and,” a continuity outside dialectical synthesis > disjunctive conjunction, aphoristic seriality
IW.linkedContent: Jew and German: “lack of transition,” a ruptivity, “and,” a continuity outside dialectical synthesis > disjunctive conjunction, aphoristic seriality

PJP.content: acolyte, anacolytic, anakolouthia, analytic figure: as much an analyst as a breach, interruption> a rupture in a set (contract), be it that of friendship, community, being-together
PJP.linkedContent: acolyte, anacolytic, anakolouthia, analytic figure: as much an analyst as a breach, interruption> a rupture in a set (contract), be it that of friendship, community, being-together

D.content: in Soller’s Numbers, cette fois enfin, “cette fois enfin” not an accomplishment w/ single blow of the pen or the die (d’écriture ou de dés): nothing could be more foreign to eschatology (of or by way of literature) than Soller’s finite-infinite seriation (enchaînement) of numbers
D.linkedContent: in Soller’s Numbers, cette fois enfin, “cette fois enfin” not an accomplishment w/ single blow of the pen or the die (d’écriture ou de dés): nothing could be more foreign to eschatology (of or by way of literature) than Soller’s finite-infinite seriation (enchaînement) of numbers

D.content: l’élément enveloppe et se décompte (deducts itself) de ce qu’il enveloppe
D.linkedContent: l’élément enveloppe et se décompte (deducts itself) de ce qu’il enveloppe

D.content: through mirror-effect (germinates/deforms), each sequence of text comprehends another > each part smaller than themselves & greater than the whole they reflect
D.linkedContent: through mirror-effect (germinates/deforms), each sequence of text comprehends another > each part smaller than themselves & greater than the whole they reflect

HST.content: substitution, cloning, series; where does human begin? abortion: subject hôte-hostage, clone w/out father?
HST.linkedContent: substitution, cloning, series; where does human begin? abortion: subject hôte-hostage, clone w/out father?

HST.content: simple, homogenous, calculation of cloning—but every unit is irreplaceable in its factual existence (Kant)—so to be ethical, must be conscious, must be auto-affected by this uniqueness? > for Derrida, displaced certainty btwn opposition arithmetic/ethical substitution
HST.linkedContent: simple, homogenous, calculation of cloning—but every unit is irreplaceable in its factual existence (Kant)—so to be ethical, must be conscious, must be auto-affected by this uniqueness? > for Derrida, displaced certainty btwn opposition arithmetic/ethical substitution

PPT.content: [re: uses of passe-partout] there could always be one use that could be taken out of the series and surround the rest, play among the others, one more turn
PPT.linkedContent: [re: uses of passe-partout] there could always be one use that could be taken out of the series and surround the rest, play among the others, one more turn

C.content: family resemblance removes none [of the 127 coffins] from itself, from the absolute secret, from definitive detachment that isolates/ab-solves outside series
C.linkedContent: family resemblance removes none [of the 127 coffins] from itself, from the absolute secret, from definitive detachment that isolates/ab-solves outside series

C.content: not one (pas un seul) must be forgotten if one wants to see or touch something of the group (genealogy or even reproduction feigned)
C.linkedContent: not one (pas un seul) must be forgotten if one wants to see or touch something of the group (genealogy or even reproduction feigned)

C.content: theory of coffins, series w/out model, w/out example (procession in double band fascinates, can’t see there’s no example) > obsequence of this cortege in singular lineage
C.linkedContent: theory of coffins, series w/out model, w/out example (procession in double band fascinates, can’t see there’s no example) > obsequence of this cortege in singular lineage

C.content: w/out example because series will have posed singular problem of initiality
C.linkedContent: w/out example because series will have posed singular problem of initiality

C.content: Titus-Carmel cadaverizes paradigm, hounds effigy of paradigm, feigning the feigning of it in a series of simulated reproductions, he reduces it, transforms it into tiny piece of waste
C.linkedContent: Titus-Carmel cadaverizes paradigm, hounds effigy of paradigm, feigning the feigning of it in a series of simulated reproductions, he reduces it, transforms it into tiny piece of waste

C.content: analogy, like the putting into series of series: must remain accidental
C.linkedContent: analogy, like the putting into series of series: must remain accidental

C.content: analogy belongs to order of contingent > appeals neither to model nor example (i.e. both Sade & Titus-Carmel ration the remainder, stage a work & jouissance re: remainder [excrement]) [Derrida is “randomly” comparing Titus-Carmel’s 127 coffins to Sade’s 120 days]
C.linkedContent: analogy belongs to order of contingent > appeals neither to model nor example (i.e. both Sade & Titus-Carmel ration the remainder, stage a work & jouissance re: remainder [excrement]) [Derrida is “randomly” comparing Titus-Carmel’s 127 coffins to Sade’s 120 days]

C.content: one cannot get to it in one go (d’un coup): multiplication shows that that which touches on the series is outside the series in the series > the remainder remains cut off, a mors, a turd, really beautiful
C.linkedContent: one cannot get to it in one go (d’un coup): multiplication shows that that which touches on the series is outside the series in the series > the remainder remains cut off, a mors, a turd, really beautiful

C.content: a turd one would like to make one’s own (s’approprier)—until the end > until is interminable
C.linkedContent: a turd one would like to make one’s own (s’approprier)—until the end > until is interminable

C.content: coffin, as the odd, as the remainder, remains entire, divisible only by itself [prime: 127], as long as you deduct one—the paradigm coffin: belongs w/out belonging to series it makes possible > inscribes itself in series, leaves on it mark of its own subtraction
C.linkedContent: coffin, as the odd, as the remainder, remains entire, divisible only by itself [prime: 127], as long as you deduct one—the paradigm coffin: belongs w/out belonging to series it makes possible > inscribes itself in series, leaves on it mark of its own subtraction

C.content: transcendental mors, fors, exceptional piece; (fait) band à part (has a hard-on, keeps aloof)
C.linkedContent: transcendental mors, fors, exceptional piece; (fait) band à part (has a hard-on, keeps aloof)

C.content: the out-of-the-series [2 discarded coffins] has the same function as the out-of-the-series in the series [?]
C.linkedContent: the out-of-the-series [2 discarded coffins] has the same function as the out-of-the-series in the series [?]

C.content: le M’hors-serie (I’m-out-of-series), Fors-series, the excluded necessary that marks the border of the Necessary itself: the necessary, the excepted, the contingent, sauf, fors
C.linkedContent: le M’hors-serie (I’m-out-of-series), Fors-series, the excluded necessary that marks the border of the Necessary itself: the necessary, the excepted, the contingent, sauf, fors

C.content: retrace one’s steps, narrative (récit), series, funeral procession/palindrome, revenir: le revenu de l’usure, le revenant, l’hôte, ghost, guest [both in English] > le coffin comme hôtel de passe (whore-hotel)
C.linkedContent: retrace one’s steps, narrative (récit), series, funeral procession/palindrome, revenir: le revenu de l’usure, le revenant, l’hôte, ghost, guest [both in English] > le coffin comme hôtel de passe (whore-hotel)

C.content: paradox of paradigm: deposed from its privilege moment it’s built, inscribed in a series, an out-of-series cartouche > remains heterogenous by virtue of its relief
C.linkedContent: paradox of paradigm: deposed from its privilege moment it’s built, inscribed in a series, an out-of-series cartouche > remains heterogenous by virtue of its relief

C.content: simili-reproduction (in fine)
C.linkedContent: simili-reproduction (in fine)

C.content: out-of-series: inhabits w/out residing, haunts, apparition of visitor is innumerable (throws arithmosophists off the trail)
C.linkedContent: out-of-series: inhabits w/out residing, haunts, apparition of visitor is innumerable (throws arithmosophists off the trail)

C.content: series: boxing, unboxing (déboitement)
C.linkedContent: series: boxing, unboxing (déboitement)

C.content: principle of order is never untouchable [re: contingent dates of a series]
C.linkedContent: principle of order is never untouchable [re: contingent dates of a series]

C.content: hiatus of series scores out (rature), in serial interlacing, reference to the other (I have called this seriature [cf. ATM]), to the other’s other > simulacrum of reference, supplementary folds
C.linkedContent: hiatus of series scores out (rature), in serial interlacing, reference to the other (I have called this seriature [cf. ATM]), to the other’s other > simulacrum of reference, supplementary folds

C.content: series as emblem of a seriature, serial interlace, supplementarity of interlacing allowing no respite to the typos > supplement transforms and detaches
C.linkedContent: series as emblem of a seriature, serial interlace, supplementarity of interlacing allowing no respite to the typos > supplement transforms and detaches

C.content: class is not lacking, it’s at work (series, lineage, rank, hierarchy, etc.) > but what doesn’t come under (n’en relève plus) class is perhaps fate (le sort) > no classification table for fate
C.linkedContent: class is not lacking, it’s at work (series, lineage, rank, hierarchy, etc.) > but what doesn’t come under (n’en relève plus) class is perhaps fate (le sort) > no classification table for fate

LI.content: set of texts, ensemble, in Limited Inc debate, are a prise de partie, partial, always lacking the completeness of a set
LI.linkedContent: set of texts, ensemble, in Limited Inc debate, are a prise de partie, partial, always lacking the completeness of a set

LI.content: argument of principle concerns a structural limit, argument is of the same kind as the set-argument [re: speech act theory’s own differentiation of itself from other theories, & thus its reliance on the metaphorical: ruined analogical value btwn speech act theory and other theories]
LI.linkedContent: argument of principle concerns a structural limit, argument is of the same kind as the set-argument [re: speech act theory’s own differentiation of itself from other theories, & thus its reliance on the metaphorical: ruined analogical value btwn speech act theory and other theories]

LI.content: [nonsynonomous synonyms]: certain functional analogy, yet remain singular/irreducible to one another, as do the textual chains from which they’re inseparable: each marked w/ iterablility that seems to belong to their series
LI.linkedContent: [nonsynonomous synonyms]: certain functional analogy, yet remain singular/irreducible to one another, as do the textual chains from which they’re inseparable: each marked w/ iterablility that seems to belong to their series

LI.content: margin, parasite, iterability belong w/out belonging to the class of concepts of which they must render an accounting—to theoretical space they organize in a “quasi”-transcendental manner: something happens by or to set theory > all this must be rendered (rendre compte et raison) by us enlightened modern thinkers, right?
LI.linkedContent: margin, parasite, iterability belong w/out belonging to the class of concepts of which they must render an accounting—to theoretical space they organize in a “quasi”-transcendental manner: something happens by or to set theory > all this must be rendered (rendre compte et raison) by us enlightened modern thinkers, right?

TN.content: [re: Nancy’s list of touchable bodies] finite series, symphonic “yes” of pleasure
TN.linkedContent: [re: Nancy’s list of touchable bodies] finite series, symphonic “yes” of pleasure

NOY.content: yes belongs w/out belonging to whole it institutes and opens; it exceeds and punctures (troue) the language in which it remains immanent: first inhabitant of language, first to step out of its home (sortir de chez lui)
NOY.linkedContent: yes belongs w/out belonging to whole it institutes and opens; it exceeds and punctures (troue) the language in which it remains immanent: first inhabitant of language, first to step out of its home (sortir de chez lui)

ATM.content: “he will have obligated (il aura obligé),” a phrase knotted up (se noue) in a certain way of tying (lier), a serial structure of a singular type > edges of the sentence in fog, belong to the night
ATM.linkedContent: “he will have obligated (il aura obligé),” a phrase knotted up (se noue) in a certain way of tying (lier), a serial structure of a singular type > edges of the sentence in fog, belong to the night

ATM.content: Levinas’ “en ce moment même” [of reappropriation] obligated by the second “en ce moment même” [of interruption] > forms a text w/ its own tear (déchirure), this “series” does not enclose the Other but opens itself up from out of irreducible difference—before any present moment
ATM.linkedContent: Levinas’ “en ce moment même” [of reappropriation] obligated by the second “en ce moment même” [of interruption] > forms a text w/ its own tear (déchirure), this “series” does not enclose the Other but opens itself up from out of irreducible difference—before any present moment

ATM.content: there must be a series of Levinas’ même moment if writing of dislocation of the Same toward the Relation [to the Other] is to have a chance, a hold (prise)
ATM.linkedContent: there must be a series of Levinas’ même moment if writing of dislocation of the Same toward the Relation [to the Other] is to have a chance, a hold (prise)

ATM.content: if the State leaves a trace of interruptions too, how does Levinas’ tracing of them differ? it ties together interruptions btwn threads [i.e. doesn’t tie threads], a series out of series (hors-série) > series: hiatus must insist
ATM.linkedContent: if the State leaves a trace of interruptions too, how does Levinas’ tracing of them differ? it ties together interruptions btwn threads [i.e. doesn’t tie threads], a series out of series (hors-série) > series: hiatus must insist

ATM.content: Levinas obligates w/out constraint, by way of nonphenomenality, to read the trace as trace, interruption as interruption (i.e. acc. as such no longer reappropriable as phenomenon of essence)
ATM.linkedContent: Levinas obligates w/out constraint, by way of nonphenomenality, to read the trace as trace, interruption as interruption (i.e. acc. as such no longer reappropriable as phenomenon of essence)

ATM.content: p. 165 since interruption is not a cut but logic of ab-solute de-stricturation, since it is reappropriable: to insist on the hiatus, the series is necessary > series has no single knot, but knots a multiplicity of retied knots (noeuds re-noués)
ATM.linkedContent: p. 165 since interruption is not a cut but logic of ab-solute de-stricturation, since it is reappropriable: to insist on the hiatus, the series is necessary > series has no single knot, but knots a multiplicity of retied knots (noeuds re-noués)

ATM.content: opening of interruption is never pure
series (file, sequence, lineage…), seira (chord, chain, lasso…), sero (interlace, braid…), eirō ties interlacing of lace, the symplokē of discourse & the link
ATM.linkedContent: series (file, sequence, lineage…), seira (chord, chain, lasso…), sero (interlace, braid…), eirō ties interlacing of lace, the symplokē of discourse & the link

ATM.content: interruptions unbound “together,” in the “same” sériature, in dia-synchrony, a serial one time of “several times” that took place only once: the ob-ligation, ligature of religion opens
ATM.linkedContent: interruptions unbound “together,” in the “same” sériature, in dia-synchrony, a serial one time of “several times” that took place only once: the ob-ligation, ligature of religion opens

ATM.content: [Levinas’ work] a fabrication of quotation marks crocheting a text w/out edge: seriality irreducibly knots a text to a language
ATM.linkedContent: [Levinas’ work] a fabrication of quotation marks crocheting a text w/out edge: seriality irreducibly knots a text to a language

ATM.content: for Levinas, to make passage to other, there can’t be an absolute erasure, withdrawal must appear, “He,” only there in seriasure, a series of hiatuses (mouth agape), enlaced erasures
ATM.linkedContent: for Levinas, to make passage to other, there can’t be an absolute erasure, withdrawal must appear, “He,” only there in seriasure, a series of hiatuses (mouth agape), enlaced erasures

ATM.content: the future anteriority of Levinas’ seriasure [each interruption will be knotted w/ another] is an eschatology w/out [beyond/otherwise than] philosophical teleology, appealing to a past anterior to any past; this future anteriority is irreducible to ontology or Hegelian teleology [in spite of irreducible resemblance]
ATM.linkedContent: the future anteriority of Levinas’ seriasure [each interruption will be knotted w/ another] is an eschatology w/out [beyond/otherwise than] philosophical teleology, appealing to a past anterior to any past; this future anteriority is irreducible to ontology or Hegelian teleology [in spite of irreducible resemblance]

AD.content: Levinas: death as ex-ception, to seize and put outside the series
AD.linkedContent: Levinas: death as ex-ception, to seize and put outside the series

AD.content: Levinas’ “beyond-in (au-delà-dans)” of State of David [?], a sort of enclave inside and outside of itself (see p. 99 border btwn ethical & political has no indivisible simplicity), participates in politics while going beyond it > [deconstructive invagination]
AD.linkedContent: Levinas’ “beyond-in (au-delà-dans)” of State of David [?], a sort of enclave inside and outside of itself (see p. 99 border btwn ethical & political has no indivisible simplicity), participates in politics while going beyond it > [deconstructive invagination]

AD.content: transcendence in immanence, the door as the bearing (porte que porte)
AD.linkedContent: transcendence in immanence, the door as the bearing (porte que porte)

AD.content: beyond-in: non-dialectical enclosure of its [paix] own transcendence
AD.linkedContent: beyond-in: non-dialectical enclosure of its [paix] own transcendence

LG.content: law of law of genre: principle of contamination, parasitical economy, participation w/out belonging
LG.linkedContent: law of law of genre: principle of contamination, parasitical economy, participation w/out belonging

LG.content: trait that marks membership (l’appartenance) divides > boundary (bordure) of set comes to form by invagination—an internal pocket larger than the whole
LG.linkedContent: trait that marks membership (l’appartenance) divides > boundary (bordure) of set comes to form by invagination—an internal pocket larger than the whole

LG.content: consequences of this division & overflowing (débordement) as singular as they are limitless (qu’illimitables)
LG.linkedContent: consequences of this division & overflowing (débordement) as singular as they are limitless (qu’illimitables)

LG.content: trait (supplementary & distinctive), re-mark of belonging doesn’t belong, this sans > a blink of the eye, w/out which nothing would come to light
LG.linkedContent: trait (supplementary & distinctive), re-mark of belonging doesn’t belong, this sans > a blink of the eye, w/out which nothing would come to light

LG.content: genre [i.e. “novel”], singular topos, gathers together the corpus and keeps it from identifying w/ itself > designation [“novel”] does not take part in the corpus
LG.linkedContent: genre [i.e. “novel”], singular topos, gathers together the corpus and keeps it from identifying w/ itself > designation [“novel”] does not take part in the corpus

LG.content: genre-clause (clause de genre): clin d’oeil, écluse (floodgate), clôture qui s’exclut de ce qu’elle inclut, déclasse ce qu’elle permet de classer > unfigurable figure of clusion, forme sans forme, neither sees day nor brings itself to light
LG.linkedContent: genre-clause (clause de genre): clin d’oeil, écluse (floodgate), clôture qui s’exclut de ce qu’elle inclut, déclasse ce qu’elle permet de classer > unfigurable figure of clusion, forme sans forme, neither sees day nor brings itself to light

BSi.content: transcategorial—“qui transcendit omne genus”: does not belong to series or table > is bêtise a transcategorial category, a quasi-transcendental?
BSi.linkedContent: transcategorial—“qui transcendit omne genus”: does not belong to series or table > is bêtise a transcategorial category, a quasi-transcendental?

OG.content: arche-writing at work in graphic and nongraphic expression, pattern uniting form & substance, all content & expression > opens temporalization, relationship w/ other & language
OG.linkedContent: arche-writing at work in graphic and nongraphic expression, pattern uniting form & substance, all content & expression > opens temporalization, relationship w/ other & language

OG.content: arche-writing cannot be an object in a linguistic system or the “immanent” system itself [glossematics] > but, doesn’t have a real field elsewhere
OG.linkedContent: arche-writing cannot be an object in a linguistic system or the “immanent” system itself [glossematics] > but, doesn’t have a real field elsewhere

OG.content: acc. Rousseau, God distributes dédommagements man receives—il est la dispense du supplément (God is the exemption from, dispensation of, the supplement) (presence: utopia)
OG.linkedContent: acc. Rousseau, God distributes dédommagements man receives—il est la dispense du supplément (God is the exemption from, dispensation of, the supplement) (presence: utopia)

ATAP.content: eschatology tells the eskhaton, end, extreme, limit, last of history, of genealogy, of a countable series
ATAP.linkedContent: eschatology tells the eskhaton, end, extreme, limit, last of history, of genealogy, of a countable series

ATAP.content: distinguishing deconstruction from simple progressive demystification [à la style of Lumières]? or why has deconstruction taken on an apocalyptic tone, multiplied distinctions btwn closure & end? I intended to analyze a genre rather than practice it, an ironic non-belonging
ATAP.linkedContent: distinguishing deconstruction from simple progressive demystification [à la style of Lumières]? or why has deconstruction taken on an apocalyptic tone, multiplied distinctions btwn closure & end? I intended to analyze a genre rather than practice it, an ironic non-belonging

EU.content: Kant’s strict separation of knowledge (truth) & power (action) distinguishes sets in excess of themselves, covering the whole of which they’re supposed to be only a part > whole forms poche invaginée in every part or subset (sous-ensemble): intestine division, folding partition inside space
EU.linkedContent: Kant’s strict separation of knowledge (truth) & power (action) distinguishes sets in excess of themselves, covering the whole of which they’re supposed to be only a part > whole forms poche invaginée in every part or subset (sous-ensemble): intestine division, folding partition inside space

SPEC.content: [Ernst’s fort/da] collective unity [of toys] is apparatus of game that can dislocate itself > word for things in this theory of set is Zeug, which is also penis: supplementary complex that can reassemble parents
SPEC.linkedContent: [Ernst’s fort/da] collective unity [of toys] is apparatus of game that can dislocate itself > word for things in this theory of set is Zeug, which is also penis: supplementary complex that can reassemble parents

SPEC.content: “set (ensemble)” of stricture, a unity that’s not subject/consciousness, begins by binding itself (se-lier) in differential relation w/ itself—it destines itself (se destine), which doesn’t mean: il arrive
